author: Zac Al-Khateeb
title: UCLA cheerleader takes hard fall during Oregon game â twice | NCAA Basketball | Sporting News
text:
February 10, 2017 12:11am EST February 10, 2017 12:11am EST The cheerleader took the fall like a champ both times. UCLA cheerleader (Getty Images) 
Updated at 12:11 a.m. ET 
Updated at 12:11 a.m. ET 
One UCLA cheerleader had a tough night when the hometown Bruins took on visiting Oregon at Pauley Pavilion on Thursday. 
During a timeout, the Bruins' cheer squad went to midcourt to get the crowd pumped up. The group's performance had the opposite effect, however, after a female cheerleader fell hard on her lower back. 
Then things got worse: As she was being removed from the court to receive medical attention, the person carrying her tripped, resulting in another hard fall. Absolute chaos at UCLA đ pic.twitter.com/03wlbFyc45 â Barstool Louisville (@BarstoolUofL) February 10, 2017 
ESPN sideline reporter Molly McGrath reported the cheerleader, whose name was not disclosed, was able to leave the court under her own power. And, better news: No. 10Â UCLA beat the fifth-ranked Ducks, 82-79, after rallying from 19 points down. Watch This
